### PR summary [6317454a18](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17222/commits/6317454a18bc9e785ed285e82a624982c9c9806a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Perm.foldl_op_eq`
`+ Perm.foldr_eq'`
`+ Perm.foldr_op_eq`
`+ foldr_assoc`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11106691812/job/30855576484)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11106691812/job/30855576102)

```suggestion
theorem foldr_left_comm : ∀ {l : List α} {a₁ a₂}, l.foldr op (op a₁ a₂) = op (l.foldr op a₁) a₂
```
no?
This is consistent with `foldl_assoc` immediately above. Happy if these get renamed together subsequently.

```suggestion
    (comm : ∀ x ∈ l₁, ∀ y ∈ l₁, ∀ z, f y (f x z) = f x (f y z))
    (init : β) : foldr f init l₁ = foldr f init l₂ := by
```
Can you use it to prove `Perm.foldr_eq`?
I'd prefer not to scope creep, please.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add missing List.foldr lemmas
